image.altText: Smoke billows over Gaza buildings

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says the federal government is organising repatriation flights to help Australians stuck in Israel, as the war's death toll passes 2,000. Follow live.

title.children: Australia announces repatriation flights from Israel as death toll passes 2,000

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: I'm in Jerusalem covering the war, and the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) has just announced it has hit the Islamic University of Gaza. In a message, the IDF claimed the university was being used as "an important operational and military centre" for Hamas. "The university was being used as a Hamas training camp for military intelligence operatives, as well as for the development and production of weapons." The IDF said fighter jets struck the university this morning.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: IDF strikes hit university in Gaza

children.content: I'm in Jerusalem covering the war, and the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) has just announced it has hit the Islamic University of Gaza.
In a message, the IDF claimed the university was being used as "an important operational and military centre" for Hamas.
"The university was being used as a Hamas training camp for military intelligence operatives, as well as for the development and production of weapons."
The IDF said fighter jets struck the university this morning.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Gaza's power authority says its sole power plant will run out of fuel within hours, leaving the territory without electricity after Israel cut off supplies. Palestinians in Gaza have long relied on generators to power homes, offices and hospitals, but now have no way of importing fuel for those either. AP
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Gaza is set to lose electricity within hours, AP reports

children.content: Gaza's power authority says its sole power plant will run out of fuel within hours, leaving the territory without electricity after Israel cut off supplies.
Palestinians in Gaza have long relied on generators to power homes, offices and hospitals, but now have no way of importing fuel for those either.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The war has entered its fifth day, and I'm in Jerusalem with the ABC's team bringing you live updates. The rockets have been steady from Gaza this morning, and while the so-called Iron Dome will stop many, this screen shot tells the story.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Continuous rocket fire from Gaza

children.content: The war has entered its fifth day, and I'm in Jerusalem with the ABC's team bringing you live updates.
The rockets have been steady from Gaza this morning, and while the so-called Iron Dome will stop many, this screen shot tells the story.

props.alt: A screen shot of a smart phone screen full of rocket alerts.

image.altText: Australian journalist Cheng Lei, who was arrested and jailed in China three years ago, has released

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says Cheng Lei arrived in Melbourne earlier today and has been reunited with her family after three years in detention.

title.children: Australian journalist Cheng Lei released from Chinese prison after serving nearly three years, reunites with family

image.altText: Chris Minns stands at a school yard

items.synopsis: A protest organiser with the Palestinian Action Group Sydney said they would launch a legal challenge after Chris Minns moved to shut down a march through the city this Sunday.

title.children: Minns says planned pro-Palestinian rally will not be allowed to 'commandeer Sydney streets'

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek stands behind Anthony Albanese at a press conference

items.synopsis: The Federal Court has ruled the government can approve coal mines without considering emissions. That's not sustainable in the long run, writes Michael Slezak.

title.children: 'Bitterly disappointed': The federal government's just had a big win against environmentalists in court

image.altText: Two election placard - one for yes, one for no

items.synopsis: Look back at our live coverage of the Voice to Parliament campaign on Wednesday, October 11.

title.children: 'There's nothing to be fearful about': Pat Dodson's Press Club message to undecided Voice voters — as it happened

image.altText: Birdsville local Don Rowlands stands outside on a day where the temperature reached 49.3C

items.synopsis: Ranger and Wangkangurru Elder Don Rowlands lived through the first referendum on Indigenous rights. With the vote on the Voice to Parliament approaching, he says it would give Indigenous Australians a seat at the table.

title.children: When Don Rowlands was young, he wasn't paid for his work on cattle stations. That changed after the 1967 referendum

image.altText: Cal Wilson wearing a green shirt, and with pink hair and glasses, holds up a microphone while smiling.

items.synopsis: Peers are paying tribute to 'one of life's best people' after comedian, writer and actor Cal Wilson died at Sydney's Royal Prince Alfred Hospital at the age of 53 after a short illness.

title.children: Comedian Cal Wilson was 'surrounded by love' before she died following a short illness

image.altText: A grid of three images of lidia thorpe speaking outside, and two men one wearing a white shirt and the other a camouflage hat

items.synopsis: Two notorious Australian Neo-Nazis are exposed as the likely architects of a menacing video in which a masked man denigrates Indigenous senator Lidia Thorpe before burning the Aboriginal flag.

title.children: A hidden timestamp on a 'menacing' Neo-Nazi video aimed at Lidia Thorpe indicates who the likely architects are

image.altText: Mert Ney, dressed in orange jumpsuit and in handcuffs gestures with his hands

items.synopsis: Mert Ney, who murdered Michaela Dunn in a stabbing attack in Sydney in 2019, has four years taken off his sentence on appeal.

title.children: Murderer Mert Ney gets prison sentence cut for 'chaotic rampage' in Sydney street

image.altText: Close up of woman's face.

items.synopsis: The daughter of Stacey Klimovitch has told a court she heard a heavy knock and someone call her mum's name before she was shot at her Stockton home.

title.children: Daughter saw 'flash', heard 'big bang' as Newcastle grandmother shot dead at front door

image.altText: A CCTV still showing a man running down a street towards a vehicle at night.

items.synopsis: A murder charge has been laid over the August attack, but NSW Police believe two men were involved.

title.children: CCTV released as police hunt for second man wanted over fatal Dubbo stabbing

image.altText: A girl walks amongst rubble in Gaza.

items.synopsis: An increase in conflict between Israel and Hamas only serves the interests of armed groups. And the people of Gaza will pay the price, writes Eric Tlozek.

title.children: The people of Gaza will pay the price for Hamas taking the violent path

image.altText: A close shot of a woman smiling, an arm around her shoulder

items.synopsis: The federal government confirms Australian grandmother Galit Carbone was killed in the unprecedented attack on Israel launched by Hamas at the weekend.

title.children: Australian grandmother Galit Carbone confirmed killed in Israel

image.altText: An older man stands outside, holding up photographs of an elderly woman.

items.synopsis: Brian Shea was not far away from his mum when her life support equipment lost power, but he had no way to know she was in deadly trouble. He believes an SMS notification system could spare others the same pain.

title.children: Man whose mum died during blackout welcomes introduction of alert system

image.altText: A young woman wearing a coordinated crochet set sits on a beach buggy

items.synopsis: Ahuva Maizel last spoke to her daughter early on Saturday. It was a brief phone call that has led to an unbearable wait for the family, who fear the 21-year-old has been kidnapped by Hamas militants.

title.children: Adi was dancing in the desert with friends. When Hamas advanced, she made one phone call

image.altText: A large brown bear wading through shallow water near a river bank.

items.synopsis: A female brown bear named Grazer is voted the winner of Alaska's popular Fat Bear Week poll.

title.children: Fat Bear Week title awarded to female who gained weight during 'single girl summer'

image.altText: Penelope Towney 3

items.synopsis: First inspired by the Black Lives Matter movement, the young First Nations trailblazer wants to preserve her culture and language for generations to come.

title.children: Penelope made her first film when she was seven, now she's sharing her Indigenous culture on YouTube

image.altText: An indigenous man speaking to a white woman at Lake Wetherill at the Menindee Lakes

items.synopsis: With amendments to the Murray-Darling Basin Plan in the spotlight, the Greens Senator travelled to outback NSW to meet locals living along the Darling River.

title.children: People of 'forgotten river' meet Sarah Hanson-Young in Menindee ahead of 'pivotal' water debate

image.altText: A man with a beard and a hat with the colours of the Aboriginal flag on its band.

items.synopsis: Prominent Indigenous leader and politician Pat Dodson says a No result in the Voice to Parliament referendum would send the country backwards.

title.children: 'Father of reconcilliation' Pat Dodson says a No result in Voice referendum would send the country 'backwards'

image.altText: Alexander Volkanovski of Australia punches Islam Makhachev of Russia in the UFC lightweight championship fight.

items.synopsis: Most men spend a lifetime preparing for the chance to win a UFC title. Alex Volkanovski has just 11 days after accepting a short-notice rematch with Russia's Islam Makhachev.

title.children: Eleven days for the fight of a lifetime: Alex Volkanovski accepts short-notice rematch for UFC lightweight title

image.altText: A composite image of Brodie Grundy, Jade Gresham and Lachie Schultz.

items.synopsis: Sydney gets its men by securing trades for ruck Brodie Grundy and midfielder Taylor Adams, while a big four-club deal has shaken up AFL trade period.

title.children: Swans complete swoops for Adams and Grundy, massive four-club deal to shake up trade period

image.altText: A smiling Alex de Minaur looks up at the crowd in the stands after winning a match at the Australian Open.

items.synopsis: Australian tennis great Lleyton Hewitt believes Alex de Minaur has the game to break into the world's top 10 and can make a deep run in January's Australian Open.

title.children: Alex de Minaur capable of ending Australian Open drought, Hewitt says

image.altText: A close-up shot of a Proserpine rock-wallaby

items.synopsis: Warren Spicer, 81, dug out a massive dam inside Dryander National Park, home of the Proserpine rock-wallaby that only lives within restricted rainforest areas of the Whitsundays region.

title.children: Man fined $14,000 for dam built in national park, home to endangered wallaby

image.altText: Graphic of Google Pay and Apple Pay logos

items.synopsis: Apple and Google will soon be required to comply with rules already imposed on credit cards and EFTPOS transactions, pushing past concerns from Apple it could harm the emerging technology.

title.children: Apple and Google's digital wallets to be brought under payment rules

image.altText: a outback shelter with cars and charging and solar panels

items.synopsis: There are not many electric car chargers along one of Australia's longest roads, but one local company has developed a prototype it hopes will help range anxiety in the outback.

title.children: 'It's very novel': Could this portable charger with solar panels solve range anxiety in the outback?

image.altText: A man smiles into the camera. He is wearing a hard hat and is at a work site.

items.synopsis: Jiangang Ji faces up to 25 years' jail over the 2021 incident, where he kidnapped the two young children of his ex-boss and sparked a major police investigation.

title.children: Man who held ex-boss's children captive and demanded $1 million ransom faces 25 years in jail

image.altText: A large crowd gathered outside the Opera House

items.synopsis: Backlash following this week's move to light-up the Sydney Opera House in the colours of the Israeli flag is not the first time the iconic landmark has been caught up in political debate.

title.children: A look back at the most politically controversial moments while the Sydney Opera House was lit-up

image.altText: Caroline Ellison walks through the door of the Federal Court in New York City with a backpack on one shoulder

items.synopsis: Caroline Ellison, the tech executive who ran Bankman-Fried’s hedge fund while sometimes dating him, tells the court he directed her to commit fraud.

title.children: Key moment in Sam Bankman-Fried's fraud case as ex-girlfriend testifies against former crypto billionaire

image.altText: A grey background with a photo of a hand putting a piece of paper in a ballot box, question marks surround.

items.synopsis: On Saturday, millions will go to the polls to cast their votes on changing the Australian constitution to establish Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Voice. Catch up on the basics to get yourself ready to vote.

title.children: What is the Voice to Parliament? Your most common questions answered in 150 words or less

image.altText: Student wearing school uniform places mobile phone into yondr pouch

items.synopsis: Kotara High School principal Mark Sneddon says the "battle with phones in class is gone" and student habits are changing at home.

title.children: Noise from the playground got louder when phones were banned. So what else happened?

image.altText: A march with a banner "Justice 4 Dougie".

items.synopsis: Regional and rural communities are struggling to access legal services amid a funding review into legal aid which sees the "missing middle" who earn too much to be eligible unable to afford private representation.

title.children: Cost of living pricing Australians out of courtrooms and putting justice on the high shelf

image.altText: Holly Willoughby in a dress standing on a red carpet and smiling as fans stand behind a barrier behind her

items.synopsis: Holly Willoughby announces she is stepping down from her presenting role on daytime programme This Morning, days after a man was charged in connection with an alleged plot to kidnap and murder her.

title.children: Holly Willoughby quits UK daytime show This Morning amid kidnap and murder allegations

image.altText: Justin Choveaux stands with another firefighter next to a vegetation fire at night.

items.synopsis: A key group representing Queensland's volunteer fire brigades pours water on the idea of a "semi-professional firefighting service" akin to the Army Reserve, saying it could alienate those already tackling this year's bushfire season.

title.children: Rural brigades boss hoses down talk of national firefighting force

image.altText: A man in a green shirt riding a white pony on a sandy field. He's leaning off the pony and placing a ring on an orange cone.

items.synopsis: Acrobatic dismounts, dramatic handovers and furious galloping are common in this niche sport, which is being played regional Victoria right now as part of a world championship event.

title.children: This equestrian sport for 'adrenaline junkies' involves balloons, socks and tennis balls
